title: Physiological Safety
subtitle: Caring for my body's needs
description: Feeling safe, supported, and regulated enough to engage with intimacy.

items.text: Upon waking: yoga, meditation, or stretching BEFORE looking at tech.
During breaks: rate pain, energy, desire on 1-10 scale.
Buffers around pain: nighttime routine, 5 minute breaths.
Safe space to explore intimacy with myself.
My body's limits are data, not a verdict.
Being in pain causes stress and negative thinking. That stress and negative thinking does not need to be dealt with head on.

title: Emotional Security & Trust
subtitle: Establishing self-trust and boundaries
description: Feeling anchored enough to explore desire with curiosity and openness.

items.text: Morning routine: daily desire check in. Name wants without judgment.
Before agreeing to something: hand on chest, quick body scan, deep breath.
Ability to say yes and no safely, even after already saying yes or no previously.
My needs are worthy of attention, even as they change.
The goal is presence in my body and experience, not securing a role or person.

title: Relational Connection
subtitle: Exploration of feelings and desires with others
description: Safe, shame-free, consensual connection for touch, sex, and play.

items.text: Before engaging in intimacy: take a moment to feel into experience. Share boundaries + needs, no matter how 'weird' it seems to share.
As it comes up: name what scares and excites me with a partner.
During cuddling: bring up arousal openly.
Find 1–2 low-pressure partners (FWB/cuddle/play) aligned on clarity + pace.
Presence of caring and consistent people in my life. People who demonstrate lack of care or consistency should be moved to secondary circles.
Experience platonic physical intimacy with close friends.
Work to disambiguate social, platonic, romantic, spiritual, sexual intimacy. Feel into the blurred lines and embrace the ambiguity.
More than one outlet → less projection on any one person.
I do not need to understand my wants before I express them.
Even if someone demonstrates a particular way of being, I do not need to do that too. Even if someone *doesn't* demonstrate a particular way of being, I am allowed to.

title: Deep Intimacy
subtitle: Integration and expression of feelings
description: Freedom to express sexuality and pursue deeper, longer relationships.

items.text: Daily: weave sensual rituals into life with self and partners. Yoga, breathing, EFT, hugs...
When aroused: Give myself a second to allow sexual fantasies to arise. Explore scenes outside my comfort zone.
Cultivate longer-term partners aligned on values + pace.
Define exploratory, lofty sexual goals.
Achieve ease and fluidity in giving and receiving love, sex, and care.
Intimacy is a garden to tend to, not a harvest to grab in one go. Spreading out my intimacy will reap a greater and more consistent harvest.
Comparison can be a source of celebration and adoration. When I am feeling envious, see how much can be reappraised as inspiration.
